user.speaker: user
user.text: how many skills can I create?

agent.speaker: agent
agent.text: The number of skills you can create depends on your Watson Assistant plan type. Any sample dialog skills that are available for you to use do not count toward your limit unless you use them. A skill version does not count as a skill: - Enterprise: 100 - Premium (legacy): 100 - Plus: 50 - Standard (legacy): 20 - Lite, Trial: 5 Additionally, after 30 days of inactivity, an unused skill in a Lite plan service instance might be deleted to free up space.

contexts.text:
You can then create a collection from a data source and configure your search skill to search this collection for answers to customer queries.

The following diagram illustrates how user input is processed when both a dialog skill and a search skill are added to an assistant. Any questions that the dialog is not designed to answer are sent to the search skill, which finds a relevant response from a Discovery data collection.

![Diagram of how a question gets routed to the search skill.](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs-content/v1/content/417db917d18067d9dcc4cf2612564a9a87c3ddc8/assistant/images/search-skill-diagram.png)





 Creating a skill 

You can add one conversation skill (actions or dialog) and one search skill to an assistant.



 Conversation 



* [Actions skill](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/assistant?topic=assistant-skill-actions-add)
* [Dialog Skill](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/assistant?topic=assistant-skill-dialog-add)







 Search 



* [Search Skill](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/assistant?topic=assistant-skill-search-add)









 Skill limits 

The number of skills you can create depends on your Watson Assistant plan type. Any sample dialog skills that are available for you to use do not count toward your limit unless you use them. A skill version does not count as a skill.



Plan details

 Plan Maximum number of skills of each type per service instance 

 Enterprise 100 
 Premium (legacy) 100 
 Plus 50 
 Standard (legacy) 20 
 Lite, Trial 5 



* After 30 days of inactivity, an unused skill in a Lite plan service instance might be deleted to free up space.

agent.original_text:
The number of skills you can create depends on your Watson Assistant plan type. Here are the maximum number of skills of each type per service instance for different plans:
- Enterprise: 100
- Premium (legacy): 100
- Plus: 50
- Standard (legacy): 20
- Lite, Trial: 5
Additionally, after 30 days of inactivity, an unused skill in a Lite plan service instance might be deleted to free up space.

llm_based_tags.reasoning: The query contains the pronoun 'I' which is clear, but 'skills' lacks context about what system or platform is being referenced. The question 'how many skills can I create?' implies a specific platform, application, or service with skill creation capabilities, but this context is not provided in the query itself. Without knowing the system being discussed (e.g., Alexa Skills, a game character, a learning platform), the query cannot be properly answered.
